world.physics.vector

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.physics.vector.Vector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Acceleration, Direction, Force, Position, Velocity

    public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of vectors involving a x and a y component.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double[] components
      The components of the vector.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector()
      Initializes this vector as the origin.
      Vector(double x, double y)
      Initializes this new vector with a given x-component and y-component.
      Vector(Vector v)
      Initializes this new vector with the components of the given vector.

      • canHaveAsComponent

        protected boolean canHaveAsComponent(double x)
        Checks whether the given component can be a component of this vector.
        Parameters:
        x - The given component.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given component is a number. | result = (!Double.isNaN(x))

      • getSum

        public Vector getSum(Vector v)
              throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Gets the sum of this vector and a given vector.
        Parameters:
        v - The given vector.
        Returns:
        A vector whose components are the sums of the respective components of this vector and the given vector. | result == new Vector(getXComponent() + v.getXComponent(), getYComponent() + v.getYComponent())
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - One of the components of the resulting vector is not a number. | Double.isNaN(result.getXComponent) || Double.isNaN(result.getYComponent)

      • getDifference

        public Vector getDifference(Vector v)
                     throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Gets the difference between this vector and a given vector.
        Parameters:
        v - The given vector.
        Returns:
        A vector whose components are the differences of the respective components of this vector and the given vector. | result == new Vector((getXComponent() - v.getXComponent()), (getYComponent() - v.getYComponent()))
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - One of the components of the resulting vectors is not a number. | Double.isNaN(result.getYComponent) || Double.isNaN(result.getXComponent)

      • getScaledBy

        public Vector getScaledBy(double factor)
                   throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Gets this vector, scaled by a given factor
        Parameters:
        factor - The given factor
        Returns:
        A vector with each of the components scaled by the factor provided in the explicit parameter. | result == new Vector(getXComponent() * scalar, getYComponent() * scalar)
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - One of the components of the resulting vector is not a number. | Double.isNaN(result.getXComponent) || Double.isNaN(result.getYComponent)

      • dotProduct

        public double dotProduct(Vector v)
                  throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Gets the inner product of this vector and a given vector.
        Parameters:
        v - The given vector
        Returns:
        The inner product of this vector and the given vector. | result == (getXComponent() * v.getXComponent()) + (getYComponent() * v.getYComponent())
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - The result is not a number. | Double.isNaN(result)

      • getMagnitude

        public double getMagnitude()
        Gets the magnitude of this vector.
        Returns:
        The magnitude of this vector. | result == Math.sqrt(this.dotProduct(this))

      • getUnitVectorInDirection

        public Vector getUnitVectorInDirection()
                                throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Gets a unit vector denoting the direction of the vector.
        Returns:
        A unit vector in the same direction as this vector. | result == this.scaleBy(1.0 / getMagnitudeTrue())
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - This vector is a nil vector. | Util.fuzzyEquals(getMagnitude(), 0)

      • getDistanceTo

        public double getDistanceTo(Vector v)
                     throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Get the Euclidean distance between this vector and a given vector.
        Parameters:
        v - The given vector.
        Returns:
        The distance between this vector and the given vector. | result == this.getDifference(v).getMagnitude()
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - The distance can't be calculated. | Double.isNaN(result)

      • getQuadrant

        public Quadrant getQuadrant()
        Returns the quadrant this vector is in.
        Returns:
        The quadrant this vector is in. | if (_X() >= 0 && _Y() >= 0) result == Quadrant.QUADRANT_I | if (_X() < 0 && _Y() >= 0) result == Quadrant.QUADRANT_II | if (_X() < 0 && _Y() < 0) result == Quadrant.QUADRANT_III | if (_X() >= 0 && _Y() < 0) result == Quadrant.QUADRANT_IV

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Checks whether the given object is a vector and its respective components are equal to this vector's components
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The given object.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given object is a vector and the respective components of the given object and this vector are equal. | result ==( o != null) && (getClass() != o.getClass()) && Util.fuzzyEquals(getXComponent(), ((Vector) o).getXComponent()) && Util.fuzzyEquals(getYComponent(), ((Vector) o).getYComponent()))

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code for this vector. Designed to be consistent with the equals method.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A hash code for this vector. | result == prime * ( prime + (int) (Double.toLongBits(x) ^ (Double.toLongBits(x) >>> 32))) + (int) (Double.toLongBits(y) ^ (Double.toLongBits(y) >>> 32))
